ticket.title: Add an option to omit the creation of hidden field with object id when using fields_for
ticket.original-body:
Some so called "ORMs" (CouchRest for example) allow to create inline associations, in this case associated objects does not have its own IDs. An option to omit the creation of hidden field with associated object id would be useful.
Usage:
@@@ ruby
# Disable hidden id field form_for(@post, :include_id => false) do |f| f.text_field :title f.fields_for(:comments) do |cf| cf.text_field :title
# Emit ids again cf.fields_for(:author, :include_id => true) do |af| af.text_field :name end end end
@@@
UPDATE: include_id_reworked.patch
ticket.latest-body:
Some so called "ORMs" (CouchRest for example) allow to create inline associations, in this case associated objects does not have its own IDs. An option to omit the creation of hidden field with associated object id would be useful.
Usage:
@@@ ruby
# Disable hidden id field form_for(@post, :include_id => false) do |f| f.text_field :title f.fields_for(:comments) do |cf| cf.text_field :title
# Emit ids again cf.fields_for(:author, :include_id => true) do |af| af.text_field :name end end end
@@@
UPDATE: include_id_reworked.patch
ticket.original-body-html:
Some so called "ORMs" (CouchRest for example) allow to create inline associations, in this case associated objects does not have its own IDs. An option to omit the creation of hidden field with associated object id would be useful.

Usage:


  # Disable hidden id field
  form_for(@post, :include_id => false) do |f|
    f.text_field :title
    f.fields_for(:comments) do |cf|
      cf.text_field :title

      # Emit ids again
      cf.fields_for(:author, :include_id => true) do |af|
        af.text_field :name
      end
    end
  end

UPDATE: include_id_reworked.patch

version.body:
Some so called "ORMs" (CouchRest for example) allow to create inline associations, in this case associated objects does not have its own IDs. An option to omit the creation of hidden field with associated object id would be useful.
Usage:
@@@ ruby
# Disable hidden id field form_for(@post, :include_id => false) do |f| f.text_field :title f.fields_for(:comments) do |cf| cf.text_field :title
# Emit ids again cf.fields_for(:author, :include_id => true) do |af| af.text_field :name end end end
@@@
UPDATE: include_id_reworked.patch
version.body-html:
Some so called "ORMs" (CouchRest for example) allow to create inline associations, in this case associated objects does not have its own IDs. An option to omit the creation of hidden field with associated object id would be useful.

Usage:


  # Disable hidden id field
  form_for(@post, :include_id => false) do |f|
    f.text_field :title
    f.fields_for(:comments) do |cf|
      cf.text_field :title

      # Emit ids again
      cf.fields_for(:author, :include_id => true) do |af|
        af.text_field :name
      end
    end
  end

UPDATE: include_id_reworked.patch
version.title: Add an option to omit the creation of hidden field with object id when using fields_for

version.body:
Patch included. Can anyone suggest a better option name? Also fixes #4550
@@@ ruby # Disable hidden id field form_for(@post, :skip_model_key => true) do |f| f.text_field :title f.fields_for(:comments) do |cf| cf.text_field :title
# Emit ids again cf.fields_for(:author, :skip_model_key => false) do |af| af.text_field :name end end end @@@
version.body-html:
Patch included. Can anyone suggest a better option name? Also fixes #4550

# Disable hidden id field
form_for(@post, :skip_model_key => true) do |f|
  f.text_field :title
  f.fields_for(:comments) do |cf|
    cf.text_field :title

    # Emit ids again
    cf.fields_for(:author, :skip_model_key => false) do |af|
      af.text_field :name
    end
  end
end
version.title: Add an option to omit the creation of hidden field with object id when using fields_for
Add an option to omit the creation of hidden field with object id when using fields_for

version.body:
I've attached a patch
We changed the option name to include_id and to invert it's boolean value, made it work with the latest 2-3-stable, added some more tests and added some documentation.
version.body-html:
I've attached a patch

We changed the option name to include_id and to invert it's boolean value, made it work with the latest 2-3-stable, added some more tests and added some documentation.
version.title: Add an option to omit the creation of hidden field with object id when using fields_for

version.body: Another idea is to check that object respond_to?(:to_key) and don't emit hidden id if result is negative? Thoughts?
version.body-html: Another idea is to check that object respond_to?(:to_key) and don't emit hidden id if result is negative? Thoughts?
version.title: Add an option to omit the creation of hidden field with object id when using fields_for

version.body:
@Daniel your patch does not applies to master.
New alternative patch "Don't emit hidden id unless model respond_to?(:to_key)"
version.body-html:
@Daniel your patch does not applies to master.

New alternative patch "Don't emit hidden id unless model respond_to?(:to_key)"
version.title: Add an option to omit the creation of hidden field with object id when using fields_for
Add an option to omit the creation of hidden field with object id when using fields_for

version.body:
to_key is a required method to be compliant with ActiveModel API. So if your model does not define to_key, something is *really* wrong. :include_key => false or :include_id => false seems to be a good way to go.
Daniel provided a good patch with documentation, it would be nice if the following patch have these as well.
version.body-html:
to_key is a required method to be compliant with ActiveModel API. So if your model does not define to_key, something is really wrong. :include_key => false or :include_id => false seems to be a good way to go.

Daniel provided a good patch with documentation, it would be nice if the following patch have these as well.
version.title: Add an option to omit the creation of hidden field with object id when using fields_for

version.body: Any news?
version.body-html: Any news?
version.title: Add an option to omit the creation of hidden field with object id when using fields_for

version.body: Marking as stale. If anyone has an interest in reopening this, please provide a patch.
version.body-html: Marking as stale. If anyone has an interest in reopening this, please provide a patch.
version.title: Add an option to omit the creation of hidden field with object id when using fields_for

version.body: Adds an :emit_hidden_id option to #form_for and #fields_for that indicates whether a hidden id field is automatically appended.
version.body-html: Adds an :emit_hidden_id option to #form_for and #fields_for that indicates whether a hidden id field is automatically appended.
version.title: Add an option to omit the creation of hidden field with object id when using fields_for

version.body: My previous patch with option name changed to :include_key. Docs included.
version.body-html: My previous patch with option name changed to :include_key. Docs included.

version.title: Add an option to omit the creation of hidden field with object id when using fields_for

version.body:
Any news on this? Suggestions/Feedback on the patches/approaches? Reasons to not merge one of them?
Without such a change it's impossible to correctly use non-AR-esque models (for example proper join models with composite keys) without using hacks and getting warnings left and right.
And please do not invalidate the ticket again just because one of the small patches does not apply cleanly anymore months after it has been posted.
version.body-html:
Any news on this? Suggestions/Feedback on the patches/approaches? Reasons to not merge one of them?

Without such a change it's impossible to correctly use non-AR-esque models (for example proper join models with composite keys) without using hacks and getting warnings left and right.

And please do not invalidate the ticket again just because one of the small patches does not apply cleanly anymore months after it has been posted.
version.title: Add an option to omit the creation of hidden field with object id when using fields_for

version.body: @gitx It cannot be applied on master due to some changes in form_helper. I am going to work on new patch this weekend. I think and hope that we should finish this ticket before 3.1.
version.body-html: @gitx It cannot be applied on master due to some changes in form_helper. I am going to work on new patch this weekend. I think and hope that we should finish this ticket before 3.1.
version.title: Add an option to omit the creation of hidden field with object id when using fields_for

version.body: Done. First patch with an option named :include_key and the second with option named :include_id. Docs and tests included. Please apply, test your apps and leave a response.
version.body-html: Done. First patch with an option named :include_key and the second with option named :include_id. Docs and tests included. Please apply, test your apps and leave a response.
version.title: Add an option to omit the creation of hidden field with object id when using fields_for
